title: Shakespeare: The Master of Universal Themes
description: Learn Shakespeare: The Master of Universal Themes in one minute.

hook.text: A 16th-century playwright wrote for illiterate groundlings and kings. Four centuries later, everyone still watches.

buildup.text: Shakespeare's genius wasn't just language â€” it was his ability to dramatize universal human conflicts.

discovery.text: Jealousy (Othello), ambition (Macbeth), love (Romeo and Juliet) â€” he mapped the full spectrum of human motivation.

twist.text: He invented over 1,700 words and countless phrases we still use: 'break the ice,' 'wild goose chase,' 'eyeball.'

climax.text: Shakespeare's plays are performed more today than in his lifetime because the emotions he captured are timeless.

punchline.text: Plots age. Human nature doesn't. Shakespeare knew both.
